page.title: 19Attitudes Crothwaite 'area'
page.content: 23 children, aged 7-12 years, dicussed 'living in 'area':-{Advantages:-}born in area therefore 'belong'; freedom to grow; space to run/play; love the countryside with its abundance of wildlife- animals; birds & flowers; beautiful views; peace & quiet; most friends live in the area. {Disadvantages:-}nearest town 7 miles; so distance to shop, for leisure activities, to visit friends/relations and to School, <long day when they attend Secondary School>.{Concerns:- conservation of area for future generations; pollution of rivers; growth of holiday homes &tourism; not much traffic now but could change; sale of working farms-house sold as private/holiday dwelling- land sold off in pieces-not handed down to sons. {Changes:-}stay just as it is; more organised activities for children.
